content: tip over and stitch it securely to the side of the main hat hang if you want to add a thread to hang the hat from you can  crochet 25-30 chains and tie to the top of the work  simply tie a thread of unworked yarn at the top  use your favourite christmas ribbon criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-christmas-hat-ornament instructions smaller size christmas hat if you are going to crochet the pompom start at pom 1 if you are going to glue/tie in a bell or pompom after start at row 1 all row are worked in the round without joining crochet pompom pom 1 with the white yarn crochet 6 single_crochet into a magic_ring pom 2 increase in each stitch 12 stitches pom 3 single_crochet around 12 stitches stuff lightly stuff the pompom pom 4 decrease all stitches 6 stitches complete one more normal single_crochet and change colour to red in this stitch you can change colour in the decrease stitch if you choose but i find it fiddly and annoying… lol continue on with row 2 christmas hat body if you start here - leave a long tail before making your magic_ring this tail will be used to sew the pompom or bell to hat and anchor the tip to the side of the brim leave the tail poke out the top of the work instead of pulling it to the inside like usual row 1 beginning with red single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring i find it helpful to put row 2 in the back loops of row 1 it is an easy method to encourage the tip to curl the right way row 2 - 4 single_crochet in each stitch around 6 stitches row 5 *increase single_crochet 2* repeat around 8 stitches row 6 single_crochet around 8 stitches row 7 *increase single_crochet 3* repeat around 10 stitches row 8-9 single_crochet around 10 stitches row 10 *increase single_crochet 4* repeat around twice 12 stitches row 11 *increase single_crochet 5* repeat around twice 14 stitches row 12 *increase single_crochet 6* repeat around twice 16 stitches row 13 *increase single_crochet 7* repeat around twice 18 stitches row 14 *increase single_crochet 8* repeat around twice 20 stitches in the last stitch change to white this is the last we use of the red yarn criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-christmas-hat-ornament brim / frill / edging i have included two choices for the end row of the hat the half_double_crochet row will give it a straight edge the shells row will give it a wavy edge another option is you can join in a strand of white flutter yarn which makes the last row really fluffy note crochet over both the red and white tail ends here now to save having to sew them in after row 15 in white - single_crochet around 20 stitches row 16 a straight edge half_double_crochet in each single_crochet around 20 half_double_crochet join with a slip_stitch row 16 b wavy edge slip stich
